intro: Malmea guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan malmea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Malmea guianensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
